review: Does anyone know if their pizza crust recipe has changed???  Went yesterday and it was flavorless and flat.  Check out the photo - Christy's pizza vs ours - suppose to be the exact same thing!

So me my sister and her friend wanted some pizza! And my sis suggested this place. So we started with appetizers and got the crispy fried mac-n-cheese. It didn't take very long and looked pretty good. But there were only 4 on the plate and they were bite size. I took a bite and it was a bit bitter. We also ordered the 5 cheese pizza and it kind of a meaty taste to it. And it didn't have much taste. The last thing was garlic noodles. They smelled WAY too much like garlic. And there wasn't enough sauce. I am not sure if I will come back to this place since I live so far.

I now consider myself the worlds foremost expert critic of cpk's.... In the last year I feel like I've been to more cpk's than the rest of my whole previously combined.. Anyway... This is a super suburban location in the suburbs right across from woodfield. Expect lots of families here doing the post mall shopping eating here.  Let me give this place an unusual comment.. Usually at EVERY cpk you get the sourdough bread with some packets for solid cement frozen butter packets.. This place actually had room temp packets. I liked that for once... :) Service here hasn't as good as I've had at other cpk's but I def thought the food quality was very good.. This is a safe one..

Dined here so MANY times! I am not an Italian pizza lover. BUT I love CPK! I love their Thai chicaken pizza and the Jamaican jerk pizza those are my 2 favoraite pizzas from here. I also love thier tortilla soup, which I typically order along with my pizza. Love this place!

Came here to celebrate my fiance's birthday. overall the place is generally pleasing. We had: Chicken quesodila (sp chk) from their small plate menu. it was tasty but overpriced for $5 for 4 small triangles. Hawaiian BBQ pizza- the star of the dinner. Ive had it frozen but never fresh and I would definitely go back for more! Im excited to try their other pizzas. Fish tacos - i am a fish taco feen and unfortunately both my favorite locations to get fish tacos are no longer serving it. This was the worst of the items we ordered. The cabbage that came on top was quite bitter and there was just not enough flavor from the fish, coleslaw or ranchito sauce. Broccoli and sundried tomato pasta- our waitress accidentally brought us the  tomato basil dish, which looked quite appetizing. She was the one who suggested we get the broccoli and tomato pasta. well she corrected the error. The pasta tasted much better the next day. overall it was good. they are lacking in the sides they offer. There was no sides that came with the pasta or chicken.

CPK is quickly becoming my new favorite restaurant in the area. My food always tastes great and seems like it was prepared well. Service is a little hit-or-miss at lunch, but the place is usually packed so I guess it can't be helped. I guess I should mention I haven't even tried the pizza yet; I have so much fun going down the menu with everything else that I often forget they serve pizza!
Got food poisoning from chicken salad with goat cheese on 6/30/12.

To start off--- obviously this is a popular CHAIN restaurant- but in my opinion they do a good job. I like their pizza- service is always friendly.  They're really great about refilling your drinks without having to ask.  If you want bread you'll have to ask, but I like the sourdough that they have there. For starters I like the small portion white corn guac and the spinach artichoke is good as well.  they also have a pretty good drink menu-- i like the mojitos.  For non alcoholic drinks the strawberry lemonade is a good choice.

Oh, this place is much better than ordering from Pizza Hut. I've been to CPK (not necessarily this CPK) about 10 times and have ordered a traditional cheese pizza every single time. It never gets old (maybe because I only eat here occasionally). And I'm able to finish the entire pizza in one sitting (about an hour in the restaurant), which is pretty impressive since I'm such a slow eater and I get full very easily. I took off one star, because the place is so busy every time I go there. The wait is never too long, maybe 15 minutes tops.

It's an A-OK for me.  I'm more of a deep dish Giordanos, Pequods, Lous, Ginos East type of guy, but since I've never been here, I decided to give it a shot. Ordered a jerk chicken pizza with bits of bacon, chicken and veggies on it.  It was ok, but didn't really blow my socks off.  Was a bit lacking with the sauce, but overall, not really sure I'd order it again.  It really sort of made me not really want to try any other pizza on the menu.   I ordered Korean steak tacos... (who does that at a pizza joint??).  Evidently, I was on some weird stuff that day, but I did it anyway.  It was actually not bad, however for two small tacos and almost 6 bucks, it's really not worth it. What really surprised me was the garlic cream fettuccine with shrimp and chicken.  My wife and I found ourselves chowing down on that more than the pizza, appetizers or anything else.  It was actually quite good. Overall, I should have probably just gone somewhere else for pasta, which was really what I didn't come here for.  It's ok though.  It was a decent meal.   Liked the key lime pie...

Drove by this place many times... and always thought... why would I want California Pizza when I can have Chicago style pizza??   However, lots of people have raved about this place and I had to find out for myself. Went here on a weekday during the dinner hours.  It appeared pretty busy but we were seated in less then 5 minutes.  This restaurant is located across the streets from Woodfield Mall in Schaumburg.  So it can get quite busy. Nice clean place... very family style and lots of kids.  Lots of booths. We ordered korean steak tacos for appetizer.  Which was ok.  I don't know if I will order them again.  But was something interesting that popped at me when I first read the menu.  It was actually $6 for 2 very small tacos.  When it was served, I almost wanted to say.. "thats it?"  For our main dish, we ordered a jerk chicken pizza and a fettucine with shrimp and chicken.  The pizza was thin crust and was ok.  Chicken kinda dry and was just missing some sauce.  However, the fettucine was awesome.  Who would've thunk!!! Was nice and creamy... that gave u that warm homely feeling.  The shrimp and chicken was cooked perfect.  Made everything melt in your mouth.  We also had a dessert here.  We chose their key lime pie... and I must say, it was pretty good.   I may have to come here and try another pizza and see if I like it.   But will definitely give the key lime pie and the pasta a go again.

Hey CPK don't lie about your menu on both the menu you hand to people AND your website. Particularly when you get there and they tell you that they dont do that salad anymore.  But besides that - we are doing ok CPK. You have mildly tasty food and pretty good service. I dont see your widespread appeal but my dining companion does so I guess thats how you make your money.  I do love the location and how bright/clean the place is.
Ok. Not a big chain fan. The staff were nice. Have had better pizza elsewhere. Salad was crisp. In no hurry to return.

As a rule I don't write reviews for chain restaurants.  They have their own advertising engines to get you through the door. However, over the weekend, we were in the Schaumburg/Hoffman area and it's nearly all chains at this point.  In deciding where to grab a quick bite for lunch it was burger this, sports bar that.. and so on. We haven't been to CPK in a while and it seemed like it would be a nice change of pace from the typical places we go. Gotta say, they've upped their game since the last time I was there. We split a nice white corn guacamole appetizer and a really tasty roasted artichoke and spinach pizza.   Some interesting and unique food, done well. The guac was fresh and the flavors on the pizza were really excellent.  Full without being overpowering. I was really pleased with each dish and the meal overall. When we are in the Woodfield area again, we'll definitely have CPK at the top of our list versus the other chain restaurants in the area.

I will no longer go to store #74 (Schaumburg) normally I love this establishment, however after our last experience I am boycotting this location and will be "blasting" them negatively. The on call manager Bruce Marvin needs to be re-educated in customer service. We have been going to this location for over 5 years, & almost every time my wife orders the fish tacos with a simple substitution of their salsa & chips for a side Caesar salad at no extra charge. Bruce is under the impression that this dish priced $10.75 should have a $2 up charge for the salad, when other sandwich dishes offer the salad as a side item already. He stated bluntly & rudely that the up charge had something to do with their price point cost difference. I know from my experience that the salad's ingredients are cheaper than the salsa and chips, when purchased in bulk from the supplier.  I have ample experience as a restaurant manager from my days at Denny's, obviously "the customer is always right," does not apply for this restaurant. I refuse to pay their stupid up charge. We simply got up and left. I hope you get retrained or let go Bruce. I put in a call to your corporate office, and will continue to call until something is done to fix this situation. On a side note, my wife visited another location today and they did not even hesitate in the slightest to give her the side salad without even batting an eye.

I would give it 0 stars if that were an option. Went in here at 9pm. Stood in front & waited.... We were never seated. Nobody looked at us or acknowledged us. I thought maybe we came in too late, but I checked the door while we were waiting & it said 10, so I figured we had plenty of time. I guess not... The place wasn't even busy. So.... We left & went to Olive Garden across the street.

I'm not generally a fan of CPK in general, but I LOVED their greek pizza. I haven't been in a few years, but one night a really had a craving for it, I was so disappointed when we got there and found out that they took the greek pizza off the menu :( I would have left if I could have. I got a white pizza instead, it was fine, nothing great. The service was a little slow and our waitress was a bit rude.  Now that they don't have greek pizza, I don't think I'll be coming back for mediocre pizza and rude service.

This is an okay restaurant. We did felt a bit rushed because they were about to close. Food was decent. Had cedar salmon, a shrimp and zucchini fettuccine, and a salted chocolate pudding. I liked the salmon. It tasted a little like wood. But i thought it was pretty good. All that including tax and tips, we payed $50. I do believe its a bit towards the expensive side.

I've eaten here before several times back when I was in high school. The items that I remember trying are the fettucini, mac & cheese, garlic chicken pizza, thai pizza, thai salad, bbq pizza. I remember that they were good, but not great. That was years ago though. Today, we had their chicken & shrimp lettuce wraps ($12.75) and works thin crust pizza ($15.25).  Lettuce wraps - 2.5 stars. Good, but not worth $13 Works pizza - 1 star at that price. The crust was crisp on the edges (good), floppy elsewhere. It reminded me of a non-toasted tortilla, in a bad way. Cheese and sauce were a huge letdown. Flavorless cheese and not enough sauce! I only ate a few bites of my slice. The max I would pay is $10, but even then, it'd rate lower than Home Run Inn's frozen pizza that I'd get for $6. Easily can make a better pizza. Can probably buy a better frozen pizza too, which shouldn't be the case for a restaurant that has the word 'pizza' in its name lol. The service was good, but then there were only two other tables at that time.
Order Sedona tortilla soup and four cheese fresh tomatoes with ham. The soup was great and the pizza was delicious. I will definitely come back and recommended.
4 Stars. Great Food. Ok Service. But Long Wait Time. I like CPK but the problem this time was that they did not serve us while we were waiting like other restaurants. But other than that I am happy.

Since for medical reasons I eact have anything with milk products, this was a strange choice for lunch. My daughter just finished her first 1/2 marathon and this is where she wanted to go, so we went. Going to any pizza place and ordering a pizza without cheese is always a fun experience. You sort of feel like everyone in the restaurant turns and looks at you when you order. But, none the less, I ordered their "Works" pizza with no cheese. The service was very slow. We were the first to arrive at the restaurant at 11AM on a Sunday, and five tables received their meals before we did. The server was pleasant enough, but I have no idea why it took so long. Fortunately, their beverage service is free flowing. Right now they serve Pepsi products but the server made a strong point that they were changing to Coke products in two weeks. So, the food experience was not great, but the overall experience was good as we thrilled in our daughter's 1/2 marathon success.

I had planned a small baby shower for a friend of mine and had called over to CPK on a Tuesday for a Saturday reservation. The gentleman that answered the phone informed me they only do same day reservations. I asked if they would be able to accommodate a group of 7 for a small baby shower and that is when the gentleman told me of their party room. He told me he would be putting me down for the party room for that Saturday. I was grateful and happy - until I arrived at the restaurant that Saturday. I walked in the restaurant early to start my small decorating process for their party room. I told the hostess who I was and reservation info. She gave me the "oh crap" face and got the manager. The "manager" first said he didn't have staff for their party room?!?! and then told me he had no information on my event?!? I explained as calmly as I could holding a 20 pound box of baby decorations what the gentleman told me on the phone. The manager then led me back to their "room" and said this isn't how they normally do things yada yada. All of the sudden Mr. Manager comes back with a waiter - so he lied about the no staff. I am giving them 2 stars because the food was excellent, our waiter was fantastic, and the mom-to-be had a great time. To Mr. Manager who could have been way more friendly we dined there on July 21st at lunch.

Had not had it except frozen for 10 years.  Went looking for a good Chicago style pizza joint but could not find one in area.  Stopped in and it reminded me of the first time I had it in Los Angeles.  Excellent pizza and just the right amount!

I'm very grateful for this place. I came for a quick lunch bite on Veteran's day. I did eight years in the Navy, and after showing my ID they said go ahead and pick anything you want on the left side of the menu - PIZZA DISHES! It's not like they had a special limited menu to pick four items from. NO. They happily repeated, "Any meal you want, left side, go ahead, its all free." I was so impressed!  Now the drink I had to cover. No problem. As I waited for the pizza to finish and reminisce with another veteran I happen to serve with in '06, they refilled my drink with ease until I took off with my pizza, they made sure my drink was full. They thanked me and gave me a generous meal. Would have paid $15.  Never had I been taken care of so well for Veteran's day. Of all the different chain restaurant/places I've been to in the past few years, this place is the best! There's no advertising in the windows that says "Veteran's Eat Free" but they put it out there online if you look it up.  - Nicholas   visited: 11/11/2013, 12:00pm

I am not sure how to rate by stars because CPK has always been one of my two favorite restaurants.  We have been frequent diners for a long time.  However, recently while eating the leftovers of the veggie salad at work (we ate there for lunch), I found a rock, and I mean A ROCK (I still have it in a bag) in my salad.  I bit down on it.  I feel very fortunate that I did not break a tooth.  I'm do not know if it was in my salad originally, or if found its way, (perhaps via the floor), into the takeout container, but it was in my salad.  While this is clearly not a good thing, the worst thing about this, is that I alerted the corporate office, and NOTHING was done by the company.  I felt this was important for the company to know, for everyone's sake (Safety).  Corporate did take my call, and supposedly alerted the store in Schaumburg.  I was told by the corporate office that I would hear back "shortly" from the store itself.   I have not heard back from the Schaumburg store, and it's been nearly a month.  I wrote back to corporate, just to let them know that Schaumburg never bothered to deal with this matter, and I haven't even heard back from them.   While I will miss eating at CPK, since the company does not handle matters properly, we will no longer eat at any CPK.  We just have too many options.  Lettuce Entertain You restaurants would have never handled (or not at all!) a situation like this.  We are willing to pay the money to eat at quality, better-run restaurants.

It is a good place for those times that your kid wants cheese pizza and you want something else. The lettuce wraps and the garlic cream fettuccine with shrimps are great choices. Not the best restaurant around, but a trustable option.

Amazing hummus dip with warm pita bread. The rest of the menu has gotten better; it went on a little roller coaster ride over the past decade and came back a couple years ago. The lot here is always packed at peak times, so that speaks for it.
Went here on new year day and had a fab experience .. Service was great .. Rene served our table .. Very friendly and warm person .. Food was excellent ..

I've always loved this place. Too bad they don't have the Peking duck pizza anymore. But it's hard not to get the Thai pizza here. But everything is good.. Everyone always orders the lettuce wraps and in my opinion, it's one of my fav appetizer. Actually here and pf changs has the best lettuce wraps. Thai salad, key lime pie. I can eat here all the time.

I'm not to crazy about chain pizza places but they just seem to get it. Service, atmosphere, and food was great. My salmon was perfect. My waiter was awesome. Great for a quick date night with the wife.

I have not been to one of these in probably 15 years. Not sure why, they just are usually not appealing to me being I live in Chicagoland where pizza does not feature things like truffle oil, chicken or BBQ sauce. But for whatever reason, I stop at this CPK today and I admit is was really good. I had a small plate blue cheese wedge with bacon and a hard boiled egg on it which was fantastic along with this great bread they bring you with herb and olive oil for dipping. Then I had the California club pizza which has chicken, bacon, a pile of rocket tossed in dressing along with slices of fresh avocado on their thin crust. Super good and light. Half is plenty for lunch so the other half goes in a box for supper later. Real good service also. I was impressed and will probably make a point to hit these again once in a while.
Good food, service was a bit slow, cocktails were ok needs improvement. The staff was ok during busy time felt rushed
The food was good and the server/service was also very good. I took out one star for having annoying music that sounded like being in an elevator and it was too loud.

I have to say I've been a fan of CPK since I was a kid.  They have a great menu that has changed just slightly since the last 15 years.  I do enjoy the new small plates that they have introduced and the best part is that you can personalize the pizzas to make them how ever you would like.  Even the salads are very good, especially the roasted veg salad is full of flavor and very filling.   As far as the service at Schaumburg, we have been very happy every time we have visited.  The Ice Tea is very good, and they never let your glass go empty.  The desserts leave a lot to be desired.  We tried the brownie Sunday and a caramel dessert, both of which were mediocre.

Decent food but nothing to get to excited about. I usually get the the California club, liked it better when they had the Asian slaw as the side instead of soup or salad option they have now. The jambalaya fettuccine is good if you like a little spice. There pizza is decent but this being Chicago there are way to many pizza places out there that are better.

Recently went to this place for the first time and I loved everything my husband is a basic meat and cheese pizza guy so he didn't care for it but if you like experimenting I definitely recommend! My favs are the lettuce wraps and the Jamaican jerk chicken pizza!
Last time we were there we got the Shaved mushroom and Bianco flat breads which were really good. Nice cosy place to grab a bite. Non pretentious and the food is always delicious.

So after driving past CPK many times in Schaumburg, me and wife finally on a Saturday evening stopped there, it was busy as expected.  We started with Cocktails which were just average and 'expensive' $9 for an average cocktail is not value. I switched to beer for next glass and it was about $6 for a pint.. so you get the idea... Starter was a flat bread with lots of cheese... again very average.. I was thinking probably the visit was first and last and then the main course came and I understood why it was crowded. Pizzas were awesome, I ordered roasted pulled pork with hot herbano salsa... one word 'Awesome'.. Wifey ordered some veggie option.. again it was great, we couldnt finish so got in the pizza boxes.. good quantity and great quality.. price was about  $12 each so I can see some value Service was slow but we were not in hurry and wanted to spend some time in lively atmosphere there so no complaints... Waitress did ok service , was probably a bit in hurry...  Overall fine experience, will go there again for pizza but will skip starter or cocktails..

Years ago when I discovered CPK, they had a Peking Duck pizza which I fell in love with. I think it was especially because of the tang of the hoisin sauce. I tried the Thai chicken pizza and it didn't quite have the same kick. The bean sprouts and carrots were excellent - clean and crunchy. I would have liked the thin crust to have been a bit crisper. The strawberry and watermelon fields salad was great - the dressing blending in with the fruit instead of overwhelming it. I would have liked to have seen the waiter a bit more - I didn't get a refill of water until I was almost done with my meal although he was pleasant when he did come by. An extra napkin or two when the meal was served would have been nice since pizza is a finger food. Great atmosphere and enjoyed the background music too. The hostess was very gracious in assisting me with seating. For a "pizza" place, a little on the pricey side but I guess the uniqueness and quality comes with a bit of a premium - the salad (half portion) and pizza (I did order whole grain and thin crust which was extra) and no drinks came up to $32 with tip.

Was so happy to hear that CPK offers gluten free pizzas. We ran out and tried the recommended gluten free margarita pizza which had little to no flavor and tasted like a cracker. The others at the table tried a variety of non-gluten free offerings and were not impressed.

Now I remember why I haven't been back in 4 years. While the genoa salad was good and the tortilla springrolls were okay, totally not worth the $23 takeout bill. The salad was worth about $5 and the springrolls at most $7. This place is another restaurant chain just pushing out uncreative food as fast as possible for the masses.

attentive service, nice atmosphere and kid friendly, wasn't too thrilled with the menu choices, they seemed limited and over priced for the type of restaurant, the ladies restroom was disgusting. I will not be returning...

We met up with some friends here last night for dinner. Our server named Justin was great. He was patient in waiting for us to order and catching up with our friends. He was also very entertaining and provided great customer service  I'm not completely sure of what our friends ordered but for appetizers we split fried mac and cheese and the avocado egg rolls. Both were brought to us warm, fresh, and crispy. My husband ordered their Wild mushroom pizza and added bacon. I ordered their quinoa arugula salad and added chicken. I am obsessed with this salad at CPK and it's the only thing I order from there. To be honest, we were disappointed in our entrees. We frequently go to the CPK closer to our home at Deer Park. The pizza my husband said wasn't nearly as good as Deer Park's CPK and the salad portion seemed smaller then the Deer Park location. Overall we had great customer service and a hilarious waiter that we would come back for as well as the appetizers/drinks, but if we want to have their main entrees we're probably going to stick to their Deer Park location.

I loved the salad. Went here for lunch with a colleague and she recommended the salads. We couldn't really decide and went with one with roasted veggies and another one with BBQ Chicken and split. Both salads were amazing. All the ingredients were fresh and tasty. The portions were very generous. Lots of chicken and avocado. The dressing was very balanced and the salads didn't drown in it, which was a huge plus. Wait time was fine for lunch and the waiter very attentive and friendly. I don't have anything bad to say about this place. I have no idea how their Pizzas are, but for salads they are perfect.

I've been to many CPKs, and I have liked every one of them. The service at this one, however, was outstanding. The restrooms were immaculate, the food was delicious, and the service by our waiter (I think his name was Andy) was so kind, patient, and informative. The location was very convenient to the mall, and I would highly recommend this overlooked spot to anyone!

This place has good food but they are very expensive for the amount you get. Maybe I am just used to more because I am from the Midwest, but it seems that the portions are lacking. They do have interesting concepts for pizza, but sometimes you just want a deep-dish slice that you are better off being eating with a fork and knife than your hands. The inside is very clean and and the staff is friendly though.

My colleagues and I have been here numerous times. They always seem to get it right! The salads are AMAZING. Everyone can find something absolutely delicious that they love. The manager Brian is incredibly accommodating and always goes above and beyond.  I love that they have a good variety of different foods, without overwhelming you with a huge menu. Great food. Great portions, Great service!! A+++

Make sure you call for curbside pickup. They don't tell you this when you orderonline, but when you pick up your food they won't come out. I waited for 15 minutes after my pick up time and my food was cold.

Was here with few other friend who were visiting me from out of state. The waiting wasn't so bad. Our waiter was nice and knowledgeable enough and offered us vegetarian options as we were all vegetarians. The only complaint I have is the portion for the pizza seem a little on the smaller side. But the overall taste and freshness was good. The inside ambiance was also nice and rich. None of us ordered any alcohol drinks so no comments on that, but their italian soda was good!
The pizza was okay, but it wasn't what I expected for never being to one before. I thought it was blan but I do think others may love it.

While my daughter was at the mall shopping with a friend, I decided to get some work done on my laptop. I saw on Yelp that California Pizza Kitchen had free WiFi, so I decided to have dinner there too. I told the hostess that I would be on my laptop and she, thankfully, put me at the last table in the back. I didn't like that it was right next to the kitchen, but I did like that I was away from other people eating. I can't remember my server's name, but she was super friendly and helpful. I had a couple of questions about things on the menu and she was able to answer them all. I usually order the white pizza, but she recommended the wild mushroom pizza. I still like the white pizza more (with bacon), but the mushroom pizza with truffle oil was good too. It never fails, though, that every time I know I'm going to want dessert at a restaurant, my server fails to ask me if I want to order some. She brought my check before asking if I wanted dessert and had to take it away because I ended up ordering the Butter Cake which was amazing.  It was like a cross between a pound cake and a cookie and I loved it with ice cream on top. YUM!
A bit pricey, but the food was great! Me and my Wife stopped in for a bbq chicken pizza and a Ceasar salad. Service was great!

I've eaten at CPK for years. 25 years ago I worked at one (the 3rd store they opened in ATL). The service is good, though very "standardized". You can always tell when corporate has started dictating service standards because they all sound the same and you really don't get personalities anymore. I can't imagine they have the kind of fun working here now as when they first opened stores almost 30 years ago. The food here is always good even though they tend to add/remove dishes alot. They've lost some good dishes - Cajun Pizza, Black Bean Angel Hair. My biggest problem with CPK now is I no longer can afford to eat here as often as I'd like. I used to go once a week but now I just go every few months. Their prices are crazy - $10 for a half salad?? Pasta dishes for $13+. Every thing has gone through the roof. Those tiny little flatbread things are like $5 or $6. Every time owner ship changes the prices go up to feed a new crop of overpaid execs I guess. Started with the founders Rick and Larry and it was a little high, but I didn't see a price hike for years. And then Pepsico got involved, then sold it back to Rick and Larry, and now its been sold a time or two to some restaurant corps. I'm giving 4 stars for really good food and service and not 5 because of their prices.

Our meal was good - quite pleased with it, however I am still not in a rush to get back or anything.  We just had the small guacamole appetizer, which was good - very small, but to be fair it was very inexpensive.  We then decided when in Rome - and ordered a pizza. Went with the wild mushroom (no truffle oil topping) and I was pretty happy with it. I liked that the crust was light and that they didn't skimp on the mushroom toppings.  We decided that splitting these two items between the two of us was pretty perfect. I'm always looking for that balance of eating enough, but not going over board and feeling too full to do anything the rest of the day.  The service was decent, it was pretty quiet at this location. They kept coming around to check if we had the bill ready when we were sitting chatting (even after we had been told by two separate associates there was no rush mind you!)  which was a little annoying, especially since it wasn't as though there weren't a ton of table open for other customers.

So, after visiting the AT&T store nearby, the wife and I suddenly found ourselves having to kill 2 hours for her phone data transfer to complete.  After a brief visit to Trader Joe's, we decided to settle for dinner at CPK... best decision of the day!  Upon entering, we noticed the renovations in process.  But it was still fairly busy for a Thursday night, which is always a good sign.  We got seated immediately and were greeted by John, or server for the evening.  Great guy, a ball of positive energy!  We ordered the tostada pizza and my favorite, the tequila lime chicken fettuccine with extra sauce.  We also ordered some of their habanero salsa on the side.  When the pizza arrived, the wife noticed the crust was different than in the past.  John told us that they changed the crust on the tostada pizza, but he gladly offered to make a new pizza on the crust we favored... awesome!   Once the revised pizza arrived, we met the manager, who ensured we were happy with our meal.  This location, despite being a chain, personified exemplary customer service.  What makes it even better, is their food is deeelish!

This is a an overdue review as it happened a while back.  But, it was so refreshing to have a manager accommodate me on a cold and rainy day and allow me to pre-order food and eat the bar with my mom.   This is not their policy but he made an exception and it was so much appreciated!  Thank you!

Great pizza and all but the prices are just ridiculous. If you're willing to spend I recommend the BBQ Chicken Pizza. It's my favorite. Kids love the cheese pizza but really you can't mess up a cheese pizza. Service is nothing to complain about really. If only this place had cheaper prices, it'd be 5 star.
I always like when I come here. I had the lobster flat bread and really enjoyed it. John was a great server, and I look forward to returning.

Just finished eating and the food was really good!!! Drinks were delicious! But most importantly our server Ashlyn I believe was so sweet and personable. The manager was very nice as well stopped by the table to make sure everything was great. Thank you for a wonderful meal California pizza kitchen!  Btw we had: California thin crust pizza, tortilla soup, adobo margarita, strawberry margarita, and sunset Caribbean sangria.

Been here twice and haven't been a huge fan of this place.  In my opinion, it's over priced and the quality lacks.  They have a decent selection.   I ordered a chicken pizza and the pizza crust was so thin and small I felt like I barely ate anything when I left and the bill was pretty hefty for very little food.  Surprisingly, the place is packed but I'm just not a fan. I've been to many pizza places in my lifetime and this is not the first place I think of when I'm really craving excellent quality pizza.

I'm surprised CPK can flourish in a pizza town like Chicago but it definitely lends a twist to the traditional deep dish.  I haven't been to CPK since I left CA but was surprised to see the wonderful new menu! They've added things like steaks and Alaskan Halibut which are some welcomed low carb additions. The seasonal flat bread which is topped with lobster salad, arugula, onions and chives is one of the best dishes I've had in a while!

I used to come here very often. I enjoyed the food and did my kids. Over the years, California pizza kitchen got more and more popular. Now I go in and the service is bad and they are very cheap. I ordered the pasta and they barely give me any sauce. Then I ask for extra sauce and they give me a little spoon. It is also very inconvenient. They always mess up our order. I am very disappointed that my favorite restaurant became one of my least.

Absolutely love the bbq chicken chopped salad. CPKs ranch dressing is to die for. They should sell it. It is soooo delicious. Whenever I'm craving salad this is my go to place. Schaumburg or Deerpark.

Had lunch with an old friend and had a really great time. The food was ready in no time! I ordered the Thai salad, which is always good. You can never go wrong! I also had their new white berry sangria which I thought was delicious, but apparently not for everyone! The service was really great and definitely was not rushed at all. I really like the interior, it was really cozy and relaxing.

New look, new menu with classic favorites. New pasta menu with unique twists on familiar plates like alfredo, but now with a lime cream sauce upgrade made for a very cool dinner. CPK is trying hard to appeal to the young crowd and millennials. The new rewards program (many restaurants are starting these) seems like a good concept so as long as there is no card. I like that we can earn while we eat to one day walk into a free entree.
They got rid of the HABANERO CARNITAS PIZZA!!!  Never eating here again. (The Butter cake is still orgasmic tho)

Worst service ever by the "greeter."  Just came back an hour ago. We came as a party of 11 to celebrate my brother's birthday. As we walked in this short haired blonde woman who was supposed to be the greeter completely ignored us. We approached her to tell her we were here as a party of 11 and she was overall indifferent and seemed to have some complexities and a power struggle because she wanted to seat us at separate tables and refused to push them in together. She didn't e plain why they couldn't be pushed together and claimed that a larger area would be an hour late---keep in mind we were the only ones waiting and this was at 8:30 and the restaurant was not ridiculously busy at all for a Friday night. She then didn't even escort us to the table...she basically just pointed the table out to us. Completely rude and unacceptable. Our server was very kind and another server or manager saw what was going on and he offered to push the two tables together. The food was just fine and very standard for what cpk is. The manager was making rounds to ask everyone how they were enjoying the food and how everything was going. He seemed to completely ignore our table---the huge table of 11. Don't know how he can miss us but he somehow totally did... We tipped very generously as our server was kind. Overall though---I was disgusted by the rude demeanor of the manager and the "greeter."
Bad expierience last night. This is the  third time that I left this restaurant without eating. They prepare food without wearing gloves
Didn't know you sold other items like soups, salads and alcohol? You got to let us know! You know how many times I have passed you up!

Thai Chicken Pizza?  What happened?  The best item on the menu has been changed.  Our waitress, who was very nice, explained that they changed the process. If you want the good flavor, request the old way (ingredients on top, not baked in). This dish was like cardboard.  Dominos would have more flavor than this bland food.

Hostess seated our party of 6 at 1:30pm on a Sunday. The restaurant was half full at the most but for some reason it took 15 minutes to even get a hello from someone. At least 4 servers walked by our table without saying a word. A table next to us who was seated after us got drinks before our table was even acknowledged. Food was mediocre at best. The lemonade was either bad or just over sweet because it burned my throat. We asked the server how many the pizzas serve and he said one. We saw what the people next to us ordered and the pizzas were clearly big enough to feed 2. So in the end we learned that the service sucks and they try to up sell you on 15 dollar pizzas that "only serve one" no thanks.
Still pleasant and fast service. No automatic group gratuity this time. Not just pizza anymore, the menu's bigger.

Had a nice all around experience, except i think the pizza costs way too much for it's size. It's $10+ per person and you don't even feel full. The jalapenos were super spicy and I liked that, I just don't see myself coming back here for pizza. It's not worth it. The pizza is delicious, but again, not worth it for how much they charge you.  Great location though, right across woodfield mall. The service was okay. It was a nice one time experience.

RUDE MANAGER. RUDE WAITRESS who dropped the f* bomb at us while the manager just watched. We decided to leave after being seated for 45 mins after not being served our drinks or apps. We still didn't have an opportunity to order our main course. We decided to take our business elsewhere and as we were walking out it seemed appropriate for her to start bringing our waters out and when she realized we were leaving she rolled her eyes and said f*** this and walked away. The manager just watched the whole thing and didn't say anything. No apology or recognition of us leaving. As someone who dines in Schaumburg often I will not be going to this location again.

I came in here for dinner with some friends after doing some Christmas shopping. It was my first time here so I didn't know what to expect. I was greeted by my server, Chris, who had eyes as blue as jelly beans and a smooth head. He was warm and friendly and recommended the spinach dip as a good appetizer for vegetarians (one of us was vegetarian). We were pleased with his service. He gave us lots of bread (the bread is the best part of this place!) when we asked. Chris seemed nice for a Jewish man, which I appreciated. The food was good, and I think I will return. I will ask for Chris. My friend (the vegetarian) complained that there was too much ice in her water and didn't know there was chicken in the barbecue salad but other than that we were pleased with the service and quality of the food. I told him merry Christmas and then I remembered he was probably Jewish so it didn't matter.

I am not a pizza guy, but my fiance had a $50 gift card from the holidays to that place. I was actually pleasantly surprised by couple of things: 1. The place looks decent - it's nothing like a regular pizzeria (that I expected) 2. We had a great service! Sergio was our waiter. He was very polite, knew what he was talking about, tried to be useful and was around when we needed him :) 3. The place was 60% occupied on Tuesday night! I ordered crispy thin crust Sicilian pizza - it had plenty of salami, less Italian sausage, less than that spicy Capicola ham, and almost no cheese. It was "crispy thin" though as promised :). My fiance ordered Shrimp Scampi Zucchini and Asparagus + Arugula Salad. Sergio brought the main dish nicely designed in a huge plate. I think she enjoyed it. I tried some of both dishes - it was fine (not in my alley - I like sweet or creamy, it was a bit sour - that's exactly how she likes it ;-). Overall, we had a good time with nice atmosphere, music and decent people around (if you know what I mean ;-)

Just discovered this place!  Comment from my daughter:  "This is the kind of place where the food actually looks like the pictures!"  Indeed... Here for lunch.  Nice, bright atmosphere.  Everything we saw go by looked delicious and all of the patrons looked happy.  I ordered a Moscow Mule to drink and we both ordered a lunch combo.  About $10 each. Bit of a hitch with that drink.  After a lonnnng wait I cancelled the order.  Our server never stopped by to address the delay.  The drink showed up shortly after my cancellation, offered for no charge.  Nice.  It was good...very gingery. I had a chicken and brie 1/2 sandwich and some sort of Greek salad.  Very yummy.  That half sandwich is huge.  Two people could easily split a full sandwich here.  My daughter had a 1/2 club and a potato soup that she love, love, loved. Service was a little slow but overall I'll definitely be back.  I really liked it.
Great service by Chris, rib eye was very good as well. The Bacon Brussels flatbread very good too. Wine and TV makes a great night out.

Love the seasonal drinks. The food average but overpriced for the quality. One of the managers yelled at the waiter for food that wasn't made right. It made a lot of the customers uncomfortable. Nobody should be humiliated by their boss in front of customers.  We will never go back.

I absolutely love California Pizza Kitchen! We got the Avocado Club Egg Rolls tonight and they were perfectly warm and crispy. I love the diversity of flavors you can get here; I have yet to find a dish I don't care for. The bar is awesome, but they also have a great assortment of non alcoholic choices. Ask for Ashlyn, she's very attentive and fun to talk to.
This has become our favorite restaurant destination over the years.  We've been there dozens of times now and have yet to have a bad experience in any way.

I haven't been here in years, and I forgot how much I love it. Love the five cheese and tomato pizza, and their fresh veggies are great. It's nice to get a side of delicious broccoli for only $1. The restaurant is clean, and the service was very attentive from Megan at lunch today. Kids menu is fabulous as well...kept my kids occupied throughout the meal and beyond. This shopping center can be dicey with traffic and parking, but it's worth it for CPK.

I think the food, drink and service combine for a 3 overall.  I enjoy the food whenever I am here and the service is decent.  I have never enjoyed an adult beverage here but the specialty lemonades are delicious.  What I like best about CPK is that they are always supporting some type of charity.  Today I dragged two of my coworkers along to help support Ronald McDonald House Charities which was great. They gave 20% of all bills to the charity. In addition they are still doing the round up for charity on each bill. I will continue to visit CPK based on their support of charities and their decent food and service.

CPK should change their name to Closed Pizza Kitchen. We called at 9PM sharp to order a carryout thin crust pie on a Tuesday night. Hours posted on the website state CPK closes at 9:30PM. The employee on the phone confirmed they close at 9:30PM, however; the kitchen had already closed for the night. F'real?!  This is unacceptable service. Why post any closing hours at all? The next night we ordered a carry out thin crust pie without a hiccup from Lou Malnati's in Schaumburg about 40 min before closing. CPK in Schaumburg, IL, you're fired!

I would give this place 0 stars if Yelp let me. I have never had a worst experience in life!  My wife and I happened to be in Schaumburg with our newborn for a day of shopping and decided to grab a quick bite. Well that didn't happen... We were greeted and seated promptly by the host but that was the end of the polite service.  We sat for 15 minutes and figured out what we wanted to eat. In that entire time. Not a single person ever made their way to our table. Not to be greeted, not to be asked for drinks, not to be asked to place starters..... Nothing.  Mind you, it was not busy at all and there were plenty of staff on hand. I don't think a single member of their staff even made eye contact with us. I kept looking around and trying to draw someone's attention but it never happened.  A waitress finally approached us or so we thought, NOPE, she went past us and to the table on our side to see what her tip was. she then walked away. Shortly after she approached us again but yet again she walked passed us to the same table and started to clean up. It was clear she had no intention of acknowledging us.  When I finally decided to get up and leave, my wife decided to tell the waitress why we were leaving. The waitress just looked at us with disgust and went about her way. Never even uttering a word, let alone an apology but Wait it gets better.  The hostess that had sat us and was eating her meal not even 5 feet away.... Told us to have a great day on the way out. She didn't even recall that we were the only people she had greeted in the last 15 minutes. On my drive out of the place I decided to call the manager to let him know how horrible we felt and how neglected we were. He apologized and then said he can offer me coupons if wanted to try again. I said no thank you and he said sorry and hang up. It's no wonder the service here is so bad. This guy could care less that we called and had no regard for our time or feelings. Thanks Brian!!!  I don't ever Yelp and I made an account just to write a review... Food for thought....but never again CPK.

Would be less than a star if yelp would let me. Came in got seated and wasn't approached by a single waitress/waiter. Was there for 15 minutes and still no one came to the table to ask for our drinks. Waitress also handed the food out to the table behind us and she still did not tell us anything. I understand if you're busy but there were several other people who could've attended us and didn't. Disappointed, really wanted to try the food. Customer service does not exist here at this place. Went to Kumas Corner instead!

Love this place completely for the quality of food and I wasn't disappointed today either. Had a Thai crunch salad, without chicken, and I love this dish, as its creamy peanut sauce makes this a very delicious salad. The ingredients are unique and the combination just brings a perfect blend.  Tried the lettuce wraps and a California veggie pizza as well. Pizza wasn't the greatest, and thats probably just me, as my family enjoyed the taste.  Tried some wine as well, Pinot Noir, which is one of my favorites.  The ambience was good, not many people for a Saturday evening. The staff not so bad. The service a bit slow, as our server kept on disappearing.  This place is good overall and being closer to a strip mall, always helps. We did some shopping in marshals and carters and headed straight to CPK. There are some nice options across the street like Cheesecake Factory and PF changs but I any day prefer CPK
Been here many times, it seems that things are getting worse and worse. Tostada pizza tasted like salad on bread. Service so so . It'll be a long time before I come back.
Amazing! Love, love, love the pizza! Service is stellar and my kids always enjoy coming to CPK! Great for families or a date night!

The pizza here is decent, but nothing worth really stopping for.  I popped in for lunch after shopping at Woodfield and got a table right away.  The food was OK and came out pretty quickly.  Bread and olive oil was the highlight.  Warm, crusty and soft inside - it was great!  The pizzas were meh, ended up taking most of them home for leftovers.   Our server was the main downfall.  He refilled drinks and got our food out quick, but we never really saw him.  Waited about 10 min after we were done to order a kids sundae (which was VERY good for $0.99!) It wasn't so busy that the staff should be overwhelmed, but we still didn't have solid service.

Very cozy and modern interior. If you order thin crust pizza, you should know that it's more personal. If both of you are hungry, you should order 2 pizzas and some appetizer. I really enjoyed Hawaiian pizza. Haven't had such a good pizza for a long time. They also have good desserts. Go for chocolate brownie. I'm definitely coming back.

I always come here. ALWAYS, love the ambient, the food choices and etc. Haven't been here in a while due to college, but I love the renovations they've done here. More chill. But one flaw (not the renovation) the bbq chicken pizza so called original, its never been that great. I prefer the BBQ chicken from Mary's Market; which is a cafe in my hometown (this was 8-5-15)

I've never been a regular at a restaurant, but my family and I are becoming regulars at this CPK. With two young children, dining out can be stressful, yet we find ourselves saying, "Let's go to California Pizza Kitchen" when we're looking for a restaurant that will be enjoyable for all. The comfortable, yet upscale atmosphere; healthy kids' menu; consistently good food (and drinks!) for the adults; and a very friendly staff (shout out to the fabulous Georgianna!) keeps us returning time after time.  Our faves include the Thai crunch salad, BBQ chicken pizza, tortilla soup, grilled veggie sandwich, potstickers, Kung Pao spaghetti, mushroom pizza, cheese and tomato pizza, and butter cake (simple, but oh-so-delish with vanilla ice cream).  Maybe my middle-agedness is showing, but this is one of my favorite dining spots!

I visited here for the first time Friday June 30,  the service was impeccable.  However the reason for my rating this place is crazy expensive for the food that they serve here. We had the fire grilled rib eye it was terrible the meat had no flavor at all added salt at the table and it still was so bland the potatoes had no flavor either.  The club eggrolls were the most delicious thing we had and  our bills was $87 for 2 people.  Crazy I will not be going back.  If the steak was good and flavorful I would have been happy to pay that kind of money but they didn't even have steak sauce!! Horrible never going back.

Good food but was charged for my food twice and still haven't been refunded the extra 34.97 they charged me. Very disappointed and will not be back.  EDIT; was taken care of by Dan if I remember correctly, GM and he did a great job explaining what happened and therefore I'm once again impressed. Besides that issue and with it being resolved, I would love to go back!

Worst location ever  Always messing with orders Was there more than 10 times and 10 times in a row something wrong. Everybody there just don't care what they doing. I love California pizza kitchen and I'm the one who visit different locations every week . If you want explore TM go to all others location besides this one. Very disappointed

My colleague and I had reminisced the nostalgia of our favorites at CPK, and decided to make it a trip for lunch.  Perhaps I should've left my memories as good memories.  I had the Jamaican Jerk Chicken on a classic crust, rather than the thin it came on.  I really liked their crust back in the day.  Memory told me that the crust was crunchy and chewy.  What I got was a little lacking.  The sauce to crust ratio was missing something.  It was dry.  Maybe I should've stuck with my classic BBQ chicken... but I was excited to try the spicy cousin of the classic bbq.  Even though the pizza was dry, the flavor of the pizza was really on point.  I love a little heat, and this was the perfect spice level.  I think it could've just used a little more sauce.   Service was great.  Our server was very personable, funny, and attentive.  Before we needed to ask for a refill on our pop, he was already there with our new glasses.  Having been a server myself, this hits a very soft spot in my hospitality heart.   I'll give it another shot.  I'll just ask for more sauce next time.
Great Steaks and love the carne as Ada pizza it's the best. Always clean and love the natural atomosphere

Honestly I can not say enough wonderful things about this place. Our server Donnie who we now come there not only for the delicious food but specifically because of him. Each time we are there, he is on top of his game. Drinks are always filled, food always hot, never a bad experience. Every employee there is always smiling and friendly. Coming here for dinner so much is something my boyfriend and I truly enjoy. 5 stars to this CPK.

Slipping and endangered establishment.  Prices out of touch.  "New" buffalo cauliflower appetizer $7.99 for five and I do mean 5 small pieces of cauliflower.  Cauliflower is an inexpensive vegetable. Get real over there.   "New" lemongrass chicken shamefully over salted and over processed. $20 bucks. Overpriced. We are not in California folks. Ick.  All and all not a good experience. Doubt We'll go back and we've been going for years. Nothing special to return to
